did.unittitle: Duke Association for Business Oriented Women records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke Association for Business Oriented Women

did.abstract: The Duke Association for Business Oriented Women (Duke BOW) was founded about 2007 and is a professional and social community of female undergraduates and alumnae of Duke University which promotes education, experience, and exchange between industry professionals and students interested in business leadership. Duke BOW records include executive meeting agendas and minutes; General Body Meeting materials; event planning documents; photographs of executive board members, general members, and events; alumni correspondence; mentorship programs; the BOW Constitution; newsletters; PowerPoint presentations; resume and interview workshops; and recruitment events.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Duke Association for Business Oriented Women (Duke BOW) was founded about 2007 and is a professional and social community of female undergraduates and alumnae of Duke University which promotes education, experience, and exchange between industry professionals and students interested in business leadership.

Duke BOW offers student-led forums, skill-building workshops, and various guest speaker events for members to find career direction, develop professional skills, build networks, learn from industry leaders, and cultivate goals.
Sources: Duke Association of Business Oriented Women website, https://www.duke-bow.com/, viewed 2020 September 13.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access restricted. Collection closed by donor request for ten years from the date of creation, unless written permission is received from the current president of Duke BOW.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Duke Association for Business Oriented Women records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Duke Association for Business Oriented Women records, 2008-2020, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Leah M. Kerr, September 2020
Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2020-0011

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Duke Association for Business Oriented Women records include interest forms used in creating BOW; executive meeting agendas and minutes; General Body Meeting materials; event planning documents including the annual Spring Business Conference; photographs of executive board members, general members, and events; alumni correspondence; mentorship programs; the BOW Constitution; newsletters; PowerPoint presentations; resume and interview workshops; and recruitment events.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access note. Contains electronic records that must be requested and accessed in our reading room. Contact Research Services with questions.

did.physdesc: 177 documents (MS Word; MS Excel; ZIP; PPT; PDF)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access restricted. Collection closed by donor request for ten years from the date of creation, 2020-2028, unless written permission is received from the current president of Duke BOW.
Access note. Contains electronic records that must be requested and accessed in our reading room. Contact Research Services with questions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Duke BOW constitution; contact lists; newsletters, Also includes event planning documents for the 2014 Google Roundtable Discussion; 2015 Nestle Brand Boot Camp; Martha Reeves Personal Finance Discussion; Bookbagging; Goldman Sachs Webinar Series; Sociology of Entrepreneurship; Dining Etiquette 101; and Networking 101. Also includes planning documents for events with Kimberly Jenkins, and Hadley Nixon.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access restricted. Collection closed by donor request for ten years from the date of creation, 2021-2022, unless written permission is received from the current president of Duke BOW.
Access note. Contains electronic records that must be requested and accessed in our reading room. Contact Research Services with questions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes event planning documents for Big Spoon Roasters; Effective Altruism; Citibank Information Session; Female Speech Patterns Workshop; Gap Rotational Management Information Session; and Negotiation 101 with Martha Reeves. Planning documents for events with Hilary Shaev; Kerrii Anderson; Mike Forman; Lauren Whitehurst; and Howie Ree are also included.
